isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - Troubleshooting - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER SELF DIAGNOSTIC TEST

note.para: The EZ-Tech, with the instrument cluster software, can be used to test the speedometer and tachometer for operation and accuracy without removing the cluster. See the EZ-Tech instrument cluster software documentation for instructions.

Prior to performing self diagnostic process ensure all DIP switches are set to "0". If a loss of prgramming is suspected, and a service tool is not available, the DIP switches may be set to "1" for use with an electronic engine. The odometer switch (Number ten (10) on right bank) should be set to "0" for miles or "1" for kilometers.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CONNECT CLUSTER DATA LINK TO MATING TEST HARNESS CONNECTOR
3. CONNECT CLUSTER TACHOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR [HAS (1) FEMALE TERMINAL]
5. CONNECT CLUSTER SPEEDOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR [HAS (3) FEMALE TERMINALS]
7. CONNECT CLUSTER TWO-SPEED CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (MUST BE CONNECTED EVEN IF THE VEHICLE DOES NOT HAVE TWO-SPEED AXLE)

step1.para: Remove the speedometer/tachometer cluster from the instrument panel and disconnect all electrical connections.
Attach Cluster Test Harness ZTSE4365 to the speedometer/tachometer unit (Figure 15).
IMMEDIATELY after inserting the power plug into the cigar lighter, depress the MOMENTARY SWITCH repeatedly at least three times as rapidly as possible (within one second).
If unit is not defective, the speedometer/tachometer unit pointers should:

step2.para: Rotate in unison to the "0" position on the gauge face.

Both pointers will then rotate in unison up the scale, in ten equal steps to the full scale [85 mph (136.8 KPH)/3500 rpm]. The odometer will advance 0.1 mile (0.1 kilometer) for each of the ten steps.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison down the scale to the "0" position.

step1.para:
If the unit fails to perform as described in the Self Diagnostic Test, continue with Step 4 on the Speedometer, Odometer and Tachometer Failure Chart
.
